ThingDef.label: Nickel Alloy
ThingDef.description: Nickel belongs to the transition metals and is hard and ductile. Nickel is a silvery-white metal with a slight golden tinge that takes a high polish. Nickel is ferromagnetic (it can become magnetized when paired with a magnetic metal).

ThingDef.label: Cobalt Alloy
ThingDef.description: Cobalt-based blue pigments have been used since ancient times for jewelry and paints, and to impart a distinctive blue tint to glass. The color was later thought by alchemists to have been caused by the metal known as bismuth. Cobalt is a magnetic metal.

ThingDef.label: Pyrolusite Ore
ThingDef.description: Pyrolusite is a black mineral and the ore of Maganese. Maganese Alloy is a highly magnetic metal.

ThingDef.label: Manganese Alloy
ThingDef.description: Manganese is a product of the black mineral called Pyrolusite. Manganese Alloy is a highly magnetic metal.

ThingDef.label: Wolframite Ore
ThingDef.description: Wolframite was highly valued as the main source of the metal Tungsten, a strong and quite dense material with a high melting temperature used for electric filaments and armor-piercing ammunition, as well as hard Tungsten carbide machine tools. Tungsten is not a magnetic metal.

ThingDef.label: Tungsten Alloy
ThingDef.description: Tungsten, also known as Wolfram or Wolframite, is a hard, rare metal. Tungsten's hardness and high density give it military applications in penetrative projectiles. Tungsten compounds are also often used as industrial catalysts. Tungsten is not a magnetic metal.

ThingDef.label: Chromium Alloy
ThingDef.description: Chromium is a steely-gray, lustrous, hard but brittle metal. It is a remarkably magnetic metal, but needs to be combined with other metals to be of use. It can be combined with Nickel and Maganese to make Nichrome Alloy at the Electric Arc Furnace.

ThingDef.label: Silver Ore
ThingDef.description: This metal is mostly used as a commodity currency. It can also be used for making attractive decorations when smelted into Sterling Silver Alloy. Silver is not a magnetic metal.

ThingDef.label: Gold Ore
ThingDef.description: The most seductive metal of them all. Millions have died in attempting to feed the endless human thirst for gold. This soft metal is little use on its own, but is strikingly beautiful and very rare. Gold is not a magnetic metal.

ThingDef.label: Iron Ore
ThingDef.description: Iron Ores are rocks and minerals from which metallic iron can be economically extracted. It can be refined in different ways to make Sulfur, Chromium, Cast-Iron and Steel. Iron is a magnetic metal, but depending on how it is processed it could lose its magnetism.

ThingDef.label: Nickel Ore
ThingDef.description: Nickel Ore is a kind of natural mineral formation where the nickel content is sufficient for a cost-effective extraction of the metal. Small amounts of Cobalt can also be extracted during the alloy making process. Nickel is ferromagnetic (it can become magnetized when paired with a magnetic metal).

ThingDef.label: Copper Ore
ThingDef.description: Copper is a ductile metal with very high thermal and electrical conductivity. Pure Copper is malleable and reddish-orange in color. It is used as a conductor of heat and electricity, a building material, and as a constituent of various metal alloys. Copper is not a magnetic metal.

ThingDef.label: Tin Ore
ThingDef.description: Tin Ore is the second-easiest ore to mine. It is mined from Tin Veins.

ThingDef.label: Bauxite Ore
ThingDef.description: Bauxite is the ore form of Aluminium. Aluminum is a silvery white, soft, nonmagnetic, ductile metal that is remarkable for the metal's low density and for its ability to resist corrosion due to the phenomenon of passivation. Unlike other raw ores, the smelting of Aluminum cannot be done by hand as the process requires electricity to work. Aluminum is paramagnetic (it becomes attracted to magnetic metals to strengthen the magnetic bond).

ThingDef.label: Ilmenite Ore
ThingDef.description: Ilmenite is the ore form of Titanium. Titanium is a chemical element. It is a lustrous transitional metal with a silver color, low density and high strength. It is highly resistant to corrosion in sea water, aqua regia and chlorine. Titanium is paramagnetic (it becomes attracted to magnetic metals to strengthen the magnetic bond).

ThingDef.label: Copper Alloy
ThingDef.description: Copper is an alloy of Copper Ore. It is mainly used for its high conductivity in electrical applications. Copper is not a magnetic metal.

ThingDef.label: Aluminium Alloy
ThingDef.description: Aluminium is an alloy of Bauxite Ore. A similar and less valuable metal than Copper, it is mainly used for its high conductivity in electrical applications. Aluminum Alloy processing requires electrical currents to function, so it cannot be done by hand at an unpowered smelter. Aluminum is paramagnetic (it becomes attracted to magnetic metals to strengthen the magnetic bond)..

ThingDef.label: Tin Alloy
ThingDef.description: Tin is an alloy of Tin Ore.

ThingDef.label: Bronze Alloy
ThingDef.description: Bronze is an alloy consisting primarily of copper, commonly with about 12% tin and often with the addition of other metals such as aluminium, manganese, nickel.

ThingDef.label: Steel Alloy
ThingDef.description: Steel Alloy is a group of iron-carbon alloys with a carbon content less than 2%. A tougher metal than cast-iron that comes with a higher production cost. Steel is ferromagnetic (it can become magnetized when paired with a magnetic metal).

ThingDef.label: Gold Alloy
ThingDef.description: Gold is a beautiful, precious alloy of Gold and Copper or Bauxite. Gold is not a magnetic metal.

ThingDef.label: Sterling Silver Alloy
ThingDef.description: Sterling Silver is a valuable alloy of Silver and Copper or Bauxite. Sterling Silver is not a magnetic metal.

ThingDef.label: Sendust Alloy
ThingDef.description: Sendust Alloy is produced by the reduction of Silicon in presence of Iron and Aluminum. Sendust is useful as a de-oxiding agent with other metals. It is more durable than standard Cast-Iron or Steel. Sendust is not a magnetic metal.

ThingDef.label: Melchior Alloy
ThingDef.description: Melchior is an alloy of Copper, Nickel and Aluminum. This alloy combination has a higher resistance to corrosion and electricity than standard alloys of Copper or Aluminum. Melchior Alloy is a magnetic metal.

ThingDef.label: Stein Alloy
ThingDef.description: Stein is an alloy of Iron, Nickel and Maganese. This combination produces a metal alloy that is tougher than Sendust Alloy. Stein Alloy is a magnetic metal.

ThingDef.label: Alnico Alloy
ThingDef.description: Alnico is an alloy of Steel, Nickel, Aluminum and Cobalt. It has a high coercivity (resistance to loss of magnetism) and is useful to make permanent magnets or magnetic shielding.

ThingDef.label: Nichrome Alloy
ThingDef.description: Nichrome is a magnetic alloy of Nickel, Chromium and Maganese. Nichrome Alloy is typically used as a more resistant electrical wiring instead of Copper or Aluminum Alloy.

ThingDef.label: Stellite Alloy
ThingDef.description: Stellite is a magnetic alloy of Cobalt, Chromium and Tungsten designed for increased wear resistance.

ThingDef.label: Ferrotitanium Alloy
ThingDef.description: Ferrotitanium is an alloy of Steel, Titanium and Carbon Fiber Alloy. It is very durable and somewhat beautiful. Ferrotitanium is not a magnetic metal.

ThingDef.label: Nitinol Alloy
ThingDef.description: Nitinol is an alloy of Nickel and Titanium. Nitinol is exceedingly difficult to make due to the exceptionally tight compositional control required, and the tremendous reactivity of Titanium. It is exceptionally durable and somewhat beautiful. Nitinol is not a magnetic metal.

ThingDef.label: Pobedite Alloy
ThingDef.description: Pobedite is a magnetic alloy of Carbon Fiber Alloy, Tungsten and Cobalt. This composite alloy possesses a particularly high hardness, similar to that of a diamond.

ThingDef.label: Titanium Alloy
ThingDef.description: Titanium is a chemical element. It is a lustrous transition metal with a silver color, low density and high strength. It is highly resistant to corrosion in sea water, aqua regia and chlorine. Titanium is paramagnetic (it becomes attracted to magnetic metals to strengthen the magnetic bond).

ThingDef.label: Wood Log
ThingDef.description: Wood from trees or other fibrous plants. Useful for building structures, weapons, and even simple prosthetics. A raw stick of wood can be used as a weapon in a pinch. It can be processed into planks or kindling.

ThingDef.label: Wood Plank
ThingDef.description: Wood planks crafted from wood logs. Useful for building structures, weapons, and even simple prosthetics.

ThingDef.label: Bamboo Log
ThingDef.description: Bamboo Logs are a type of wood-like grass. It is a fast growing wood alternative that is useful for construction.

ThingDef.label: Bamboo Plank
ThingDef.description: Bamboo Planks are crafted from Bamboo Logs. They are useful for building structures, weapons and even simple prosthetics.

ThingDef.label: Cloth
ThingDef.description: Cloth is woven from the raw organic fibers of a Cotton Bush. These fibers are called Raw Cotton.

ThingDef.label: Muffalo Wool
ThingDef.description: Muffalo Wool is soft, light and provides very good insulation. Wool clothes can keep the body warm even in extreme conditions.

ThingDef.label: Dromedary Hair
ThingDef.description: Dromedary Hair clothing is usually worn by desert travelers to protect them from the heat. It provides excellent insulation due to its thermostatic properties.

ThingDef.label: Alpaca Wool
ThingDef.description: This is the remarkably soft wool of an Alpaca. It is useful for clothing.

ThingDef.label: Hemp
ThingDef.description: Hemp is a type of cloth woven from Weed. It is the same weed that people like to light up and smoke. Watch out for fire sources!

ThingDef.label: Ram Wool
ThingDef.description: This is the exceptionally soft wool of a ram.

ThingDef.label: Devilstrand Cloth
ThingDef.description: Fabric spun from microfibers extracted from silk-producing Devilstrand Mushrooms. Very tough, but insulates no better than Cloth.

ThingDef.label: Synthread
ThingDef.description: Spacer-tech synthetic fabric designed for making ordinary clothes. It is soft, light, strong, and insulates well.

ThingDef.label: Hyperweave
ThingDef.description: High-tech nano-fibers woven into sheets. It is somewhat heavy, but is incredibly difficult to break. The secrets of its production are known only to the most advanced GlitterWorld cultures.

ThingDef.label: Kevlar
ThingDef.description: Kevlar is a woven combination of plastic and synthetic fibers that is often used for combat-related protective armor.

ThingDef.label: Chitin
ThingDef.description: Chitin is a long-chain polymer. It can be obtained from the exoskeletons of insects or shelled creatures.

ThingDef.label: Raw Healroot
ThingDef.description: A pack of herbal concoctions typically extracted from the Healroot Plant. It is less potent than industrial pharmaceuticals.

ThingDef.label: Medicine
ThingDef.description: Medicine is a combination of various medical supplies that medical personnel can use to heal the wounded.

ThingDef.label: Advanced Medicine
ThingDef.description: Advanced medical supplies from a high-tech GlitterWorld. A more potent version of standard medicine that can greatly aid in even the most serious of injuries.

ThingDef.label: Herbal Medicine
ThingDef.description: Herbal Medicine is a basic collection of plant-based supplies that medical staff use to treat the wounded.

ThingDef.label: Glass Batch
ThingDef.description: Raw Glass Batch that was made from Sand. It would be more useful when it is refined into Glass Frames.

ThingDef.label: Glass Frame
ThingDef.description: A transparent material that is quite popular despite being fragile. Glass is produced from Glass Batch, which is made from Sand.

ThingDef.label: Reinforced Glass Frame
ThingDef.description: A stronger version of Glass Frames that is harder to work with, but has more potential uses.

ThingDef.label: Raw Cotton
ThingDef.description: Raw Cotton from a Cotton Bush. It can be spun into Cloth at a Tailor's Workbench.

ThingDef.label: Raw Devilstrand
ThingDef.description: Raw Devilstrand from a Devilstrand Mushroom. It can be spun into Devilstrand Cloth at a Tailor's Workbench.

ThingDef.label: Kindling
ThingDef.description: Kindling is made from Wood Logs or Bamboo Logs. It can be used as fuel in the Steam Generator.

ThingDef.label: Compost
ThingDef.description: Compost is made from Wooden Logs, Nitre and Ash in a Composter. It is used for enriching the fertility of soils or for creating Hydroponic Basins.

ThingDef.label: Sand
ThingDef.description: Sand can be crushed from Rubble or gathered from the ground. It is a necessary ingredient in making Glass Batch and Silicon.

ThingDef.label: Silicon
ThingDef.description: Silicon is the one of the most common elements in the universe by mass, but very rarely occurs as the pure free element in nature. It can be produced by smelting Sand.

ThingDef.label: Ethanol Fuel
ThingDef.description: A can of Ethanol Fuel produced from Wheat, Corn or Rice at a Brewery. It can be used to fuel the Steam Generator.

ThingDef.label: Electronic Components
ThingDef.description: An Electronic Component is any basic discrete device or physical entity in an electronic system used to affect electrons or their associated fields. Basic electronic devices like Cook Stoves or Coolers use Electronic Components to process electricity.

ThingDef.label: Integrated Circuits
ThingDef.description: An Integrated Circuit is a set of electronic circuits on one small plate of semiconductor material, which is normally silicon. This can be made much smaller than a discrete circuit made from independent Electronic Components. It is useful for more advanced electrical devices such as Solar Generators or a Comms Console.

ThingDef.label: Microchip Integrated Circuits
ThingDef.description: Microchip Integrated Circuits are Integrated Circuits that have had a microprocessor installed. It is a computer processor that incorporates the functions of a computer's central processing unit (CPU) on a single Integrated Circuit, or at most a few Integrated Circuits. It is useful for highly advanced electronic devices, such as Geothermal Generators.

ThingDef.label: BioElectronic Devices
ThingDef.description: BioElectronic Devices are bionic micro-electronic chips. These devices are too delicate and intricate to make by human hands. They need to be created through assistance via the robotic assembler.

ThingDef.label: BioMatter
ThingDef.description: BioMatter can be extracted from a humanlike corpse. It can be used to grow natural organs in an Organ Vat.

ThingDef.label: Artificial Bone
ThingDef.description: A carefully crafted synthetic bone piece. It is useful for repairing damaged bones.

ThingDef.label: Nitre
ThingDef.description: Major uses of potassium nitrate (Nitre) are in fertilizers, tree stump removal, rocket propellants and fireworks. It is one of the major components of Gunpowder.

ThingDef.label: Coal Ore
ThingDef.description: A black lump of Coal Ore. It is a useful reaction agent in metal alloy smelting.

ThingDef.label: Charcoal
ThingDef.description: A blackened lump of Charcoal. It is a useful Coal Ore substitute made by burning Wood Logs or Bamboo Logs.

ThingDef.label: Rubble
ThingDef.description: Rough Rubble stones are created by smashing stone chunks or blocks. It can be gathered from gravel on the ground. It is a useful ingredient for concrete. It can also be smashed further to produce Sand.

ThingDef.label: Ash
ThingDef.description: Ash is obtained by burning Corpses or other materials in a Crematorium or Fire Pit.

ThingDef.label: Depleted Uranium Alloy
ThingDef.description: Depleted Uranium Alloy is created by refining Uranium Ore through a Gas Centrifuge. The dangerous radiation has been removed, resulting in a unique high density and strong metal ideal for armor plating or armor-piercing projectiles.

ThingDef.label: Carbon Fiber Alloy
ThingDef.description: Carbon Fiber Alloy is an extremely strong and light fiber-reinforced nanomaterial polymer, which contains carbon fibers. It is created at a Chemical Laboratory.

ThingDef.label: Concrete
ThingDef.description: Concrete is a composite material composed of Sand and Rubble. It is a fluid material that bonds into a solid material over time. It can have metals added to create Reinforced Concrete, a durable and solid building material.

ThingDef.label: Peat
ThingDef.description: Peat, also known as turf, is an accumulation of partially decayed vegetation or organic matter that is unique to natural areas, such as peatlands, mires and swamps.

ThingDef.label: BioDiesel Fuel
ThingDef.description: A can of BioDiesel Fuel produced from Bean Pods at a BioRefinery. It can be used to fuel the BioGenerator.

ThingDef.label: Snow Block
ThingDef.description: Tightly packed snow formed into building blocks. It can melt if the temperature is above freezing. It can be built into a snow wall for a fast, cheap barricade.

ThingDef.label: Soft Clay
ThingDef.description: A lump of raw clay that was gathered from water sources on the ground. It can be baked into Clay Bricks at a Smelting Furnace.

ThingDef.label: Clay Bricks
ThingDef.description: A brick of hardened clay baked at a Smelting Furnace. It can be used for construction purposes.

ThingDef.label: Gunpowder
ThingDef.description: Gunpowder, also known as black powder, is the earliest known chemical explosive. It is a mixture of Sulfur, Coal Ore and Nitre. The Sulfur and Coal Ore act as fuels, and the Nitre is an oxidizer.

ThingDef.label: Napalm
ThingDef.description: Napalm is flammable liquid used in warfare. It is a mixture of a gelling agent and petroleum or a similar fuel.

ThingDef.label: Prometheum
ThingDef.description: Military-grade incendiary agent, ignites on contact with oxygen. The raw resource is used to craft incendiary ammo of all kinds.

ThingDef.label: FSX
ThingDef.description: High-explosive chemical extracted from Boomalope sacks, it is used in a variety of industrial and military applications.

ThingDef.label: Crude Oil
ThingDef.description: Crude Oil is extracted from an Oil Fissure through use of an Oil Extractor. It can be refined at a Petrochemical Plant to produce Polymers, Paraffins, Sulfur, Synthetic Ammonia and Fuel Oil.

ThingDef.label: Polymers
ThingDef.description: Polymers are a product of refined Crude Oil. It is a useful raw material used in creation of Plastic, Rubber, Synthetic Fibers and Carbon at a Petrochemical Plant.

ThingDef.label: Plastic
ThingDef.description: Plastic is a useful raw material for building construction or item production or weapons.

ThingDef.label: Rubber
ThingDef.description: Rubber is useful for a variety of things such as duct pipes, pumps or as a building material supplement/additive.

ThingDef.label: Synthetic Fibers
ThingDef.description: Synthetic Fibers are artifical strands created from Polymers and Sulfur. They can be woven into Synthread Cloth at a Tailor's Workbench, or woven with Carbon into Carbon Fiber Alloy at a Chemical Laboratory.

ThingDef.label: Carbon
ThingDef.description: Carbon is a fiber-reinforced polymer that is an extremely strong and light. It can be reinforced further with Synthetic Fibers to create Carbon Fiber Alloy at a Chemical Laboratory.

ThingDef.label: Synthetic Ammonia
ThingDef.description: Synthetic Ammonia is a product of refined Crude Oil. It is useful for fertilizing soil or creating Impaction Charges.

ThingDef.label: Paraffin
ThingDef.description: Paraffins are a product of refined Crude Oil. It is useful in crafting medicines.

ThingDef.label: Sulfur
ThingDef.description: Sulfur occurs naturally as the pure element - native sulfur and as sulfide and sulfate minerals. Sulfur can be obtained from refined Crude Oil at a Petrochemical Plant or from processing Iron Ore at an Ammo Crafting Table. It is useful for Gunpowder in crafting various types of turret ammo.

ThingDef.label: Sulphates
ThingDef.description: Sulphates

ThingDef.label: Fuel Oil
ThingDef.description: A type of fuel created from refined Crude Oil. It is needed to power the Fuel Power Plant.

ThingDef.label: Inorganic Matter
ThingDef.description: A container of Inorganic Matter. It can be made at an Inorganic Matter Converter from various types of raw resources or refined into specific resources. It can be used to feed a Hadron Collider for AntiMatter production.

ThingDef.label: Drill Head
ThingDef.description: A Drill Head for the Drilling Rig. Drilling Rigs are placed on Deposits of Crude Oil to drill Oil Fissures. These are openings in the ground that can produce Crude Oil through the use of an Oil Extractor.

ThingDef.label: Pile of Books
ThingDef.description: A random assortment of books. Most are old and discarded classics, but occasionally a good quality book can be found.

ThingDef.label: Painting Supplies
ThingDef.description: A large assortment of brushes and paints. Perfect for any aspiring artist.

ThingDef.label: Mineral Sonar Module
ThingDef.description: This is a Mineral Sonar Module. When deployed on the field with some energy packs, it can scan the surrounding area for metallic objects or Hidden Deposits of Ores.

ThingDef.label: Alpha Poly
ThingDef.description: The first iteration in artificially constructed, atomically assembled dense matter. This man-made, extremely rare material is only assembled in high end matter assemblers and is good for building structures in the chronospheres of stars.

ThingDef.label: Beta Poly
ThingDef.description: The second iteration in artificially constructed, atomically assembled dense matter. This man-made, extremely rare material is too expensive to be mass produced, and has only been used as material for indestructable space suits, unstoppable kinetic slugs and containment for miniture black holes.

ThingDef.label: AntiMatter
ThingDef.description: AntiMatter in the form of anti-atoms is one of the most difficult materials to produce. AntiMatter in the form of individual anti-particles however, is commonly produced by particle accelerators and in some types of radioactive decay.

ThingDef.label: Magnetic Material
ThingDef.description: An advanced combination of strong magnetic materials. Creation of such material is beyond the fabrication skills of anyone but an electromagnetic physicist.

ThingDef.label: BioSynthetic Material
ThingDef.description: BioSynthetic Material is an advanced, high ductility material.

ThingDef.label: HexCell
ThingDef.description: A compact energy storing device. It is generally used for powering advanced weaponry or shock absorbers in powered armor.

ThingDef.label: Compound Paste
ThingDef.description: A bottle of compound paste, used for various crafting processes. The label reads: "DO NOT DRINK! Avoid sticking your fingers on surfaces after use!".

ThingDef.label: Thrumbo Horn
ThingDef.description: The horn from a previously living Thrumbo. It's razor-sharp, very hard and priceless in most markets. This is a true trophy.

ThingDef.label: Robot Parts
ThingDef.description: Robot Parts.

ThingDef.label: Glowstone
ThingDef.description: While the safety of these glowing rocks is questionable, they do provide a good amount of light, especially with reflective silver.

ThingDef.label: Coldstone
ThingDef.description: A creamy white stone that seems to radiate coldness. It stays cold for a very long time.

ThingDef.label: Repair kit
ThingDef.description: A kit of resources to repair an item.
